messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Llano???
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/4/2000 7:09:25 PM Central Daylight Time, ...  ... Ooh, us too!  We in Dallas hit 111 on Monday, too.  Unfortunately, the dog got out
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/4/2000 7:09:25 PM Central Daylight Time,
x_t_sipr@... writes:

> ohhhhhh yes, I know exactly where you are (Llano/Fred)!!! ohhhhhh, the TX
> hill country is one of our *fav* places to go camping in the fall/spring
<G>
> ... we're HOPING to get the *camping itch* in a few wks when the weather
> cools off a bit but NOT RIGHT NOW :P
>

Ooh, us too! We in Dallas hit 111 on Monday, too. Unfortunately, the dog
got out and decided to frolic in the neighborhood, so I had a bit more of the
environment than I would have cared for. But today is actually cool -- in
the 90s. I heard Austin reached 112 yesterday!!!!!! Oh, my.

Can't wait to break out the camping gear. Haven't been all summer. Maybe
I'll just go upstairs and start an inventory. I know a few things have
walked away from the boxes in the last few months. Now let's see. . .

Carron

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Llano???
messages.msgSnippet: welllllllll, we ll hate to see you go but I m SURE you ll LOVE living in the PNW :)  good luck w/ relocating, I m sure everything will work out fine, just fine
messages.messageBody:
welllllllll, we'll hate to see you go but I'm SURE you'll LOVE living in the
PNW :) good luck w/ relocating, I'm sure everything will work out fine,
just fine :)

*wished* we didn't have to be in SA (near the rr) b/c we'd LOVE to live out
in the STICKS <G>

Pris ~> who'z trying to NOT be JEALOUS of her hill country neighbors :}

WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...

Melodie
